LanguageData.Plant_MSPerrywinkle.label: Perrywinkle
LanguageData.Plant_MSPerrywinkle.description: Catharanthus roseus, commonly known as bright eyes, Cape periwinkle, graveyard plant, old maid, pink periwinkle, rose periwinkle, is a species of flowering plant in the dogbane family Apocynaceae. It is grown as an ornamental and medicinal plant, used to treat cancer.
LanguageData.MSPerrywinkleLeaves.label: Perrywinkle Leaves
LanguageData.MSPerrywinkleLeaves.description: The perrywinkle leaves can be used to extract vinca alkaloids, a precursor to some chemotherapy treatments
LanguageData.MSVincaAlkaloid.label: Vinka Alkaloid
LanguageData.MSVincaAlkaloid.description: Vinca alkaloids are a set of anti-mitotic and anti-microtubule alkaloid agents originally derived from the periwinkle plant: Catharanthus roseus (basionym Vinca rosea) and other vinca plants. They block beta-tubulin polymerization in a dividing cell. This is a precursor chemical used in chemotherapy drugs.
